briefTitle: Human C1 Esterase Inhibitor (C1-INH) in Subjects With Acute Abdominal or Facial Hereditary Angioedema (HAE) Attacks
officialTitle: Human Pasteurized C1 Esterase Inhibitor Concentrate (CE1145) in Subjects With Congenital C1-INH Deficiency and Acute Abdominal or Facial HAE Attacks
summary: HAE is a rare disorder characterized by functional C1 esterase inhibitor deficiency. If not treated adequately, the acute attacks of HAE can be life-threatening and may even result in fatalities, especially in case of swelling of the larynx. This clinical Phase 2/Phase 3 study was designed to provide clinically relevant data on dosing, efficacy and safety in subjects with HAE.

primaryOutcome.measure: Time to Start of Relief of Symptoms From HAE Attack
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Up to 24 h after start of study treatment
